titleStmt.title: M. L. Broadwill to James F. Robinson
CWG1505

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency Jas F Robinson Gov of Ky -- The undersigned the County Judge of Harrison County would states that heretofore James Kellar stands indicted in the Circuit Court ^of this Co^ for murder by killing Jno Dills; that Kellar is also implicated in the murder of Daniel Waits Esq of this County within the last 60 days and said Kellar is fleeing from justice. The undersigned prays that a reward be offered by the Governor for the apprehension of the accused May 30th 1863 --

M. L. Broadwill, Judge H. Co
A, H, Ward
